title: Why America Is Depressed, Lonely, and Not Having Kids
description:
Dr. Brad Wilcox of the University of Virginia gave this lecture to the Patristic Nectar Marriage Conference to explain why marriage is the bedrock of civilization and why it matters more than ever in America today. He connects the decline of marriage to loneliness, low fertility, and social decline, and offers practical ways to rebuild family, faith, and community.

title: Don‚Äôt Torment Your Guardian Angel
description:
As Christmas approaches, Father Josiah reflects on the ancient Christian teaching of the guardian angel and how one is given to each believer at holy baptism. Drawing from Holy Scripture, the Psalms, and the writings of St. Basil the Great and St. Macarius, he explains how sin does not only grieve God, but also torments our guardian angel.

2:26 ‚Äì One angel as an entire encampment
3:06 ‚Äì How Christians should relate to their guardian angel
3:30 ‚Äì Story of St. Macarius and the weeping angel
5:28 ‚Äì ‚ÄúHe has become a slave of the demons‚Äù
5:36 ‚Äì A warning about sins of the flesh
6:00 ‚Äì Prayers for a guardian of soul and body
6:25 ‚Äì Angels and the Nativity of Christ
7:05 ‚Äì Final exhortation

title: Christianity Isn't a Metaphor
description:
Bishop Irenei explains why Orthodoxy does not treat doctrine as metaphor, preference, or symbolism, but as reality revealed by God. Christianity is not endlessly redefinable. The Church clearly identifies the boundaries of right belief, not to punish, but to protect us from living in unreality.

title: Vanity is Killing Men | Ask Father Josiah
description:
In this special ‚ÄúAsk Me Anything‚Äù episode, Father Josiah Trenham responds to heartfelt questions from listeners about Holy Communion, sexual sin, despair, vanity, war, Marian devotion, and more. Drawing on the Scriptures, the Holy Fathers, and pastoral experience, he offers both clarity and deep encouragement for struggling Christians.

title: AI Erotica
description:
Father Josiah gives a reflection on the rise of AI-generated erotica and the spiritual catastrophe of pornography in the digital age. Father also exposes how tech giants are fueling addiction, destroying relationships, and enslaving souls ‚Äî and calls us to purity, discipline, and custody of the eyes.

Prayer against Internet Pornography üëá
Before turning on the computer, make three bows, kiss the holy
icons, and say:
*O Lord Jesus Christ, my God and Savior, through the prayers of
Thy Most Pure Mother and of my Patron Saint and Guardian
Angel, preserve me from all sinful pleasures in all my senses; help
me not to look at evil and impure images that will harm my soul
and separate me from Thee; help me to cut off the desire to
indulge in such unchaste activity; and help me rather to do work
that is productive and pleasing to Thee and to Thy Church, that I
may glorify Thee, together with Thine Unoriginate Father and the
Most Holy, Good and Life-creating Spirit, now and ever and unto
the ages of ages. Amen.*

title: Rotten Priests
description:
In this reflection, Father Josiah draws from Scripture and Church tradition to speak candidly about the reality of rotten priests. From the examples of Aaron‚Äôs sons, Eli‚Äôs sons, and Caiaphas, to the dangers of unrepentant clergy today, this talk addresses betrayal, scandal, and the misuse of priestly authority. Yet it also emphasizes humility, repentance, and the mercy of God who can even work through human failure.

title: Temperance in the Face of Violence
description:
In this reflection, Father Josiah Trenham explores the Christian virtue of temperance in the midst of violence. How can we respond to hostility, injustice, and the temptations of anger with restraint rooted in Christ? Drawing on Scripture, Patristic wisdom, and pastoral experience, Fr. Josiah offers a compelling vision of self-control and holiness.

title: The Orthodox Teaching on Contraception
description:
Purchase it here: https://store.patristicnectar.org/contraception-and-the-orthodox-church-paperback/

In this exclusive interview, Dr. Tikhon Pino introduces his latest book *Contraception and the Orthodox Church* , published by Patristic Nectar Publications. The book explores 2,000 years of Orthodox teaching on marriage, family life, and the ethical issue of contraception. Dr. Pino discusses the consistent witness of the Church Fathers, the encyclicals of the Church of Greece (1937 & 1978), and the myths surrounding contraception in the Orthodox world.

title: The Voice in Your Head
description:
In this sermon, Father Josiah Trenham reflects on the teachings of Hebrews 9 and the role of the conscience in the Christian life. Father Josiah discusses the power of the conscience ‚Äî the inner voice that distinguishes good from evil ‚Äî and how sin can dull, darken, and even enslave the soul. Yet through Christ, repentance, and the study of the Gospels, the conscience can be renewed and strengthened.

title: Bishop Irenei on Sacraments Outside the Church
description:
In this teaching, Bishop Irenei addresses the often-asked question: Does the Orthodox Church acknowledge sacraments outside her life? He explains that the Orthodox understanding of the sacraments (or mysteries) is rooted in the life of the Church as the Body of Christ. By definition, sacraments are acts of the Church, enacted by Christ through His Body, and therefore cannot exist apart from her.

title: Learning to Love the Right Things
description:
In this reflection, Father Josiah Trenham teaches on the lifelong work of learning to love what is truly good, beautiful, and eternal. Drawing on an illustration from Joshua Gibbs, he shows that just as one can learn to love coffee through practice and immersion, so too Christians must re-train their hearts to love God, virtue, and the things that endure.

description:

title: Does the Church Curse Those Outside the Church?
description:
Bishop Irenei explains the true meaning of "anathema" in the Orthodox Church. Far from being a curse, the anathemas proclaimed on the Sunday of Orthodoxy are pastoral warnings, pointing out the boundaries of the Christian faith and lifting souls to God‚Äôs mercy. In this teaching, Bishop Irenei shows how the Rite of Orthodoxy reflects both love and truth, guiding us back to Christ and His Church.

title: Theosis is Our Destiny
description:
In this reflection, Fr. Josiah Trenham explores the true goal of salvation: union with God, transformation by His grace, and glorification in Christ.
Drawing on Holy Scripture, the Feast of the Transfiguration (August 6), the Dormition of the Theotokos (August 15), and the witness of the Holy Fathers and saints, Father Josiah explains why salvation is not only forgiveness of sins, but participation in the divine life itself.

title: Bishop Irenei on the Immaculate Conception
description:
Bishop Irenei gives a clear and direct Orthodox Christian answer to the question: Is the Roman Catholic doctrine of the Immaculate Conception compatible with the Orthodox faith? In this concise teaching, His Grace explains the historical, theological, and pastoral reasons why the Orthodox Church rejects this doctrine ‚Äî and how true veneration of the Theotokos must be rooted in the life of the Church and the teachings of the Holy Fathers.

title: What Makes Jesus‚Äôs Baptism So Much Greater?
description:
What‚Äôs the real difference between John the Baptist‚Äôs baptism and the baptism of Jesus Christ? In this powerful Orthodox reflection, Fr. Josiah Trenham explains why John‚Äôs baptism‚Äîthough it forgave sins‚Äîwas only a partial prelude to the life-giving, Spirit-filled baptism offered by Christ. Drawing on Holy Scripture, the Church Fathers (especially St. Photius the Great), and deep Orthodox theology, Fr. Josiah shows why Christian baptism is more than water‚Äîit's fire, Spirit, renewal, and adoption into the family of God.

title: Prophet Elias: A Type of Christ
description:
In this powerful reflection, Father Josiah Trenham explores how the Holy Prophet Elias (Elijah) prefigures our Lord Jesus Christ. From miraculous acts, fierce asceticism, and fiery confrontations with idolatry, to his heavenly ascension, Elias stands as a vivid type of Christ in the Old Testament. Discover how Elias's life foreshadows the Incarnation, the miracles of Christ, and the coming of the Holy Spirit. Released in honor of the Prophet‚Äôs feast day, July 20th, this message will inspire renewed devotion to Christ and gratitude for His saints.

title: The Orthodox View of Ecumenism
description:
Bishop Irenei of London & Western Europe (ROCOR)

In this powerful reflection, Bishop Irenei responds to a question from a faithful Orthodox Christian in Mexico, explaining the true meaning of ecumenism, the difference between Orthodox unity and modern ecumenical efforts, and why Orthodox Christians cannot accept a diluted vision of the Church. This video dives deep into the teachings of the Ecumenical Councils, the meaning of ‚ÄúOne Holy Catholic and Apostolic Church,‚Äù and how Orthodox theology views dialogue, truth, and ecclesial identity.

title: Escaping Shame by Shame
description:
In this reflection Fr. Josiah explores the powerful spiritual teaching of Mother Macrina and Saint John of Sinai on repentance, posture in prayer, and escaping shame through humility. Learn how bodily prayer and true confession can bring inexpressible joy, freedom, and grace. Featuring insights from the New Saints and Elders course at the St. John Chrysostom Catechetical School, this talk draws on modern and ancient wisdom to guide us toward genuine repentance and communion with God.

title: The Double Gaze
description:
This Pentecost reflection, titled The Double Gaze, explores the profound moment of Christ's Ascension‚Äîhow Jesus, while blessing the disciples, fixed his loving gaze on them as He rose to the right hand of God. Discover how this gaze continues today, through the ministry of the Holy Spirit, and how Christians return that gaze by setting their hearts on things above. Featuring commentary from Acts, Colossians 3, and St. John Chrysostom, this message calls us to a life of heavenly orientation, empowered by Pentecost.

description:

From Pride Month pushback to the renaming of the Harvey Milk Navy ship, this is a call to resist moral compromise and return to Christian foundations.

title: Christianity without Pentecost?
description:
In this powerful reflection, Father Josiah Trenham explains why Pentecost is essential to the very existence of Christianity. Without the outpouring of the Holy Spirit, the apostles would never have preached, the Church would never have been born, and the Christian faith would not have spread. Discover how Pentecost completes the saving work of Christ and launches the Church into her divine mission.

Bishop Irenei of London & Western Europe (ROCOR)

Is modern self-care just another form of idolatry? In this powerful Orthodox Christian reflection, we explore the hidden dangers of self-worship in today‚Äôs comfort-obsessed world. Drawing on the story of Moses and the golden calf, this sermon challenges us to examine how we treat ourselves ‚Äî not just physically, but spiritually. Have we made an idol out of our own desires, comforts, and image?

title: Ending Atheistic Education
description:
In this reflection, Father Josiah Trenham responds to a recent Supreme Court ruling involving a Catholic charter school in Oklahoma. He uses the case to highlight deeper concerns about the lack of school choice, the forced public funding of anti-Christian education, and the overall decline of moral and academic standards in the U.S. education system. Why are families restricted from directing their tax dollars to schools that reflect their values? What are the long-term effects of an aggressively secular public school system?
Is there hope for restoring freedom and faith in American education?

Father Josiah calls for renewed moral clarity, Christian engagement, and educational liberty in a time of deep cultural confusion.

title: Emperor Constantine and Cultural Renewal
description:
What can one man devoted to God do for a culture in collapse? On the eve of the feast of Saints Constantine and Helen, we reflect on Emperor Constantine's life, divine calling, and the lasting renewal he brought to a crumbling world. In a time when Christian culture is fading in the West, Constantine stands as a powerful witness to what godly leadership can accomplish. This talk explores the relationship between Church and state, the collapse of secular ideologies, and the possibility of Christian restoration in our own time.

title: What Robots Will Never Do
description:
In this reflection, Fr. Josiah Trenham challenges our culture‚Äôs obsession with science and technology ‚Äî and calls us back to the deeper knowledge of faith, love, and wonder. What robots and artificial intelligence will never do isn‚Äôt just technical ‚Äî it‚Äôs spiritual. This video explores why the unseen things of life ‚Äî God, truth, logic, love ‚Äî are what make us truly human. Featuring insights from Fr. Alexander Schmemann and a critique of STEM absolutism, this is a message for all believers navigating a technological age.

title: The Heresy That Denied Repentance
description:
Father Alexis Torrance & Father Josiah Trenham

What happens when Christians believe repentance is impossible after serious sin? In this compelling conversation, Fr. Josiah Trenham and Fr. Alexis Torrance explore the early Church heresy of Novatianism and its rejection of mercy for apostates. Learn why the Church condemned this puritanical movement, and discover the deep meaning of Christlike repentance‚Äîrepenting not just for ourselves, but for others. This episode brings to life the teachings of St. John Chrysostom, St. Paul, and the saints who stood "in the breach" for the world.

title: You Promised to Obey with Joy
description:
At baptism, we promise to unite ourselves to Christ and to keep His commandments with joy. This short reflection by Father Josiah reminds us that obedience to Christ is not merely rule-following, but the loving response of those who have died and risen with Him. Especially for the newly illumined, it's a call to live out what we‚Äôve promised‚Äîdaily, faithfully, and joyfully.

title: Your Greatest Obstacle
description:
In this reflection, Fr. Josiah Trenham discusses how pride often stands as the greatest obstacle in our spiritual lives. Drawing from the wisdom of Elder Arsenie Papacioc, he explores how humility is not just a virtue, but a necessity for true Christian growth. This talk offers clear, direct guidance for anyone seeking to overcome inner struggles and deepen their walk with Christ.

title: What ‚ÄòFallen Nature‚Äô Really Means
description:
Father Josiah Trenham + Bishop Irenei

What does it really mean to say that humanity has a ‚Äúfallen nature‚Äù? Is this just Western theological baggage ‚Äî or is it deeply rooted in Orthodox tradition? In this video, we explore how the Orthodox Church understands the language of the ‚ÄúFall‚Äù ‚Äî not as a doctrine of total depravity, but as a profound spiritual condition described throughout the Fathers, liturgical texts, and scripture. Discover why Orthodox theology still uses terms like "fallen man," and how fasting, almsgiving, and true repentance are tools for healing, not punishment.

title: What Jesus Really Meant By "Repent"
description:
Father Alexis Torrance & Father Josiah Trenham

What did Jesus really mean when He said ‚ÄúRepent‚Äù? Discover the deeper meaning of the Greek word metanoite and why repentance isn‚Äôt a one-time act‚Äîbut a lifelong transformation. In this video, we explore the threefold path of repentance as taught by the ascetic fathers, including Saint Mark the Ascetic and Saint Isaac the Syrian. Learn how repentance is not just confession of sin, but a total reorientation of the mind and heart toward Christ.

Drawing from Scripture and the Church Fathers, Father Josiah discusses how true spiritual transformation requires both intellectual assent and practical obedience, guiding believers toward union with Christ.

title: Transhumanism, Feminism, and the Crisis of Modern Masculinity | RattlesnakeTV
description:
Father Josiah joins @rattlesnaketv  for a deep conversation on the cultural and spiritual challenges of our time. As transhumanism reshapes human identity and modern feminism redefines gender roles, masculinity faces an unprecedented crisis. What are the long-term consequences of these shifts, and how can faith and tradition offer clarity in a rapidly changing world?

title: No Other Gods - Do This and You Will Live
description:
Join Father Josiah Trenham in this profound reflection on No Other Gods, exploring the essential connection between faith, obedience, and the commandments of Christ. As many are rediscovering the depth of Orthodox Christianity in a secular age, this talk emphasizes the necessity of not only understanding Christian doctrine but also living it‚Äîtranslating belief into action through fidelity to God's commandments.

Drawing from Scripture and the Church Fathers, Father Josiah discusses how true spiritual transformation requires both intellectual assent and practical obedience, guiding believers toward union with Christ.

title: What Gift Can You Offer the Virgin?
description:
Join Father Josiah as he delves into the profound significance of the Annunciation. In this video, he explores the moment when the Archangel Gabriel brings the divine message to the Virgin Mary, announcing that she will conceive the Son of God. With deep theological insights, Father Josiah highlights the rich meaning of this sacred event in Orthodox Christianity, showing how it marks the beginning of our salvation. Reflect on the mystery of the incarnation and the impact of the Annunciation in the life of the Church and for all believers.

title: Terms of Endearment
description:
Join us for the Spring Conference at St. Andrew Orthodox Church, Riverside, CA, March 21-23, 2025. Focus on repentance with Bishop Irenaeus and Father Alexis Torrance. *Register at*  www.conference.patristicnectar.org.

In this video, Father Josiah explores the significance of speech and the impact of words in building relationships, particularly in marriage. Drawing from the teachings of St. John Chrysostom, we reflect on how husbands can use language to uplift their wives and strengthen their bond. The video also highlights God's use of terms of endearment throughout scripture and how we can incorporate these into our own lives.

Bishop Irenei of London & Western Europe (ROCOR)
Did you know the Orthodox Church has another liturgy besides the Divine Liturgy? Bishop Irenei reveals the mystery of the Presanctified Liturgy‚Äîa unique and ancient service celebrated during Great Lent. Discover why it's different, when it's used, and how it deepens spiritual life. Don't miss this eye-opening explanation!

title: Lowest Common Denominator Christianity
description:
Why do so many Christians today settle for the least amount of effort? Fr. Josiah Trenham exposes the problem of Lowest Common Denominator Christianity‚Äîa mindset where believers do just enough to feel religious without truly committing to Christ. From skipping church services to avoiding spiritual discipline, this lukewarm approach is weakening the faith. Watch as Fr. Josiah challenges Christians to go beyond the bare minimum and embrace a life of real devotion.

title: "Faith Healers" and the Meaning of Suffering
description:
Fr. Josiah Trenham delves into the biblical and theological foundations of faith healing, offering a clear and insightful perspective on one of the most debated topics in Christian life. He examines the claims of modern faith healers, contrasting them with the miraculous healings recorded in Holy Scripture and the lives of the Saints, revealing what true healing looks like from an Orthodox Christian perspective.

description:

Life often feels overwhelming, filled with challenges, suffering, and relentless temptations. Why is it so brutal? Discover the most significant heresies that challenged early Christian beliefs and shaped Church doctrine. In this video, we dive into controversial teachings like Gnosticism, Arianism, and other heresies that sparked theological debates in the early Church. Learn how these false doctrines were addressed and what the Church did to preserve orthodox Christian faith. Whether you're a history enthusiast or curious about early Christianity, this exploration of heresies will deepen your understanding of Church history and doctrine.

Jonathan Pageau

Help us professionally record the Philokalia! Donate by visiting the link below.

Patristic Nectar Twitter: https://bit.ly/3igrH4f


‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîSUPPORT PATRISTIC NECTAR‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

1) Spread the Word - tell your family and friends about Patristic Nectar. Share Patristic Nectar website links to content you have enjoyed. A personal invitation is the number one way the Church grows. Tell a friend to "Come and see!"

2) Make a Donation -Patristic Nectar is a small non-profit ministry with a big vision for expanding access to Patristic Orthodox teaching throughout the world. Since our establishment in 2010, we have made steady progress but there is so much more we could do. With funding, we can work to make our ministry vision a reality. 

https://patristicnectar.org/donations

3) Pray For Us - remember us in your prayers, asking that the Lord strengthen, help, and direct us according to His divine will.

title: BIG NEWS For Patristic Nectar
description:
https://patristicnectar.org

In celebration of our 14th year of ministry, we are excited to announce a significant gift to our followers: all of our Theological Lectures are now available completely FREE! 

 This marks a radical shift in our ministry's approach, reflecting our commitment to sharing more content for free and we believe it aligns with God's calling for us.

We hope this change brings more people closer to God by having Orthodox Christian online content more accessible and available to anyone without the barrier of fees.

This step is a huge leap of faith for us, and we invite you to join us in prayerfully considering how you can support this new chapter. 

Your monthly donation, no matter the amount, will help sustain and expand our efforts to provide enriching content online.

Thank you for being part of our journey and for your continued support.

title: Don't Miss Out! 2024 PNP Conference "The Sacred Arts" | March 29 -31, 2024 | Riverside,  California
description:
Tickets are only $60 for in-person, live stream, and recordings. 

Access the Live Stream here: https://crowdcast.io/c/sacredarts/FktJG

"The Sacred Arts: Preaching the Gospel Without Words"
When: March 29 - 31, 2024
Speakers: 
Fr. Maximos Constas
Jonathan Pageau

Lecture 1 - The Origin of Sacred Art
Lecture 2 - How Iconography Preaches the Gospel
Lecture 3 - How to Read An Icon
Lecture 4 - How Architecture Preaches the Gospel
Lecture 5 - How Music Preaches the Gospel
Sermon by Fr. Maximos Constas

Friday Night - Young Adult Mixer with Pub Trivia! 

Register here: www.conference.patristicnectar.org

Where: Riverside, California, or watch live from your screen

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîSOCIAL MEDIA‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Patristic Nectar Instagram: https://bit.ly/3kmupqE
Patristic Nectar Facebook: https://bit.ly/33Bzmpx
Patristic Nectar Twitter: https://bit.ly/3igrH4f


‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîSUPPORT PATRISTIC NECTAR‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

1) Spread the Word - tell your family and friends about Patristic Nectar. Share Patristic Nectar website links to content you have enjoyed. A personal invitation is the number one way the Church grows. Tell a friend to "Come and see!"

2) Make a Donation -Patristic Nectar is a small non-profit ministry with a big vision for expanding access to Patristic Orthodox teaching throughout the world. Since our establishment in 2010, we have made steady progress but there is so much more we could do. With funding, we can work to make our ministry vision a reality. 

https://patristicnectar.org/donations

3) Pray For Us - remember us in your prayers, asking that the Lord strengthen, help, and direct us according to His divine will.

*Are you getting married, already married, or want to be married one day?

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present, "Enduring Love: Laying the Christian Foundations for Marriage" by Fr. Josiah Trenham. A new resource for engaged couples, married couples, singles hoping to wed, and priests preparing them.

Be edified by 10 chapters on various topics, discussion questions, scenarios, and write notes in this workbook along with your future or current spouse. Purchase the paperback workbook at your favorite bookseller. (Amazon, Barnes & Noble, etc)

Foreword by Bishop Basil (Essey)
Chapter 1 - God's Design for Marriage
Chapter 2 - Love and Expectations
Chapter 3 - Friendship and Goals
Chapter 4 - Communication and Conflict
Chapter 5 - Sex and Romance
Chapter 6 - Children and Parenting
Chapter 7 - Roles and Responsibilities
Chapter 8 - Finances
Chapter 9 - Spiritual Life
Chapter 10 - Enduring to the End
Appendix - The Orthodox Rite of Marriage

- ISBN# 978-1735011653 

*Our Newest Lecture Series:*

‚ÄúThe Holy Trinity‚Äù by Fr. Thomas Hopko 

Listen to FOR *FREE* here: https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122222111222

LECTURE TITLES
Lecture #1 - Jesus and the One God. 
Lecture #2 - How Does Jesus Relate to God?
Lecture #3 - Who Do People Say That I Am? (Part 1)
Lecture #4 - Who Do People Say That I Am? (Part 2)

Our Newest Lecture Series:

The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles

Click Here: https://patristicnectar.org/store_lectures

 Our Newest  Lecture Series:
The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles by Father Josiah Trenham. 

The Acts was written by the Holy Apostle and Evangelist Luke, as the 2nd part of his great literary masterpiece setting forth the Life of Jesus Christ in his Gospel, and then in the Acts showing forth the new Christian life made possible by the Lord‚Äôs great and saving deeds and the descent of the Holy Spirit. Here in these sacred pages we discover what St. Paul calls ‚Äúnew creation in Christ.‚Äù

Here we discover what is the birth-right of Christians ‚Äì that is the continuous miracle of church life. Lecture titles are as follows: 

Lecture #1 The Meaning of the Acts 

Lecture #2 Pentecost 

Lecture #3 Spiritual Life 

Lecture #4 Fellowship 

Lecture #5 Martyrdom 

Lecture #6 Conversion 

Lecture #7 Defending the Faith: The Jerusalem Council 

Lecture #8 The Missionary Journeys of St. Paul 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles

 Our Newest  Lecture Series:
The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles by Father Josiah Trenham. 

The Acts was written by the Holy Apostle and Evangelist Luke, as the 2nd part of his great literary masterpiece setting forth the Life of Jesus Christ in his Gospel, and then in the Acts showing forth the new Christian life made possible by the Lord‚Äôs great and saving deeds and the descent of the Holy Spirit. Here in these sacred pages we discover what St. Paul calls ‚Äúnew creation in Christ.‚Äù

Here we discover what is the birth-right of Christians ‚Äì that is the continuous miracle of church life. Lecture titles are as follows: 

Lecture #1 The Meaning of the Acts 

Lecture #2 Pentecost 

Lecture #3 Spiritual Life 

Lecture #4 Fellowship 

Lecture #5 Martyrdom 

Lecture #6 Conversion 

Lecture #7 Defending the Faith: The Jerusalem Council 

Lecture #8 The Missionary Journeys of St. Paul 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

*Our Newest Lecture Series:

‚ÄúThe Holy Trinity‚Äù by Fr. Thomas Hopko 

Listen to FOR FREE here: https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122222111222

LECTURE TITLES
Lecture #1 - Jesus and the One God. 
Lecture #2 - How Does Jesus Relate to God?
Lecture #3 - Who Do People Say That I Am? (Part 1)
Lecture #4 - Who Do People Say That I Am? (Part 2)
Lecture #5 - Understanding Our Being in Regards to the Holy Trinity.
Lecture #6 - The Trinity and the Filioque.
Lecture #7 - Human Life in Imitation of God.
Lecture #8 - Recapitulation.
Lecture #9 - Living the Divine Life in This World.
Lecture #10 - If You Want to Be Saved.
Lecture #11 - Iconography Regarding the Trinity.

These lectures were delivered in February of 2001 to the clergy of the Western Region (eventually the Diocese of Los Angeles and the West) of the Antiochian Orthodox Christian Archdiocese of North America. In these lectures Father Hopko opens to all the dogmatic teaching of the Orthodox Church on One God, His Only-Begotten Son our Lord Jesus Christ, and the Holy Spirit. Here Fr. Thomas shares how Christian life  is a sharing in the Divine Life itself, and much more. 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

*Are you getting married, already married, or want to be married one day?

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present, "Enduring Love: Laying the Christian Foundations for Marriage" by Fr. Josiah Trenham. A new resource for engaged couples, married couples, singles hoping to wed, and priests preparing them.

Be edified by 10 chapters on various topics, discussion questions, scenarios, and write notes in this workbook along with your future or current spouse. Purchase the paperback workbook at your favorite bookseller. (Amazon, Barnes & Noble, etc)

Foreword by Bishop Basil (Essey)
Chapter 1 - God's Design for Marriage
Chapter 2 - Love and Expectations
Chapter 3 - Friendship and Goals
Chapter 4 - Communication and Conflict
Chapter 5 - Sex and Romance
Chapter 6 - Children and Parenting
Chapter 7 - Roles and Responsibilities
Chapter 8 - Finances
Chapter 9 - Spiritual Life
Chapter 10 - Enduring to the End
Appendix - The Orthodox Rite of Marriage

- ISBN# 978-1735011653

Our Newest Lecture Series:

The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles

Click Here: https://patristicnectar.org/store_lectures

 Our Newest  Lecture Series:
The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles by Father Josiah Trenham. 

The Acts was written by the Holy Apostle and Evangelist Luke, as the 2nd part of his great literary masterpiece setting forth the Life of Jesus Christ in his Gospel, and then in the Acts showing forth the new Christian life made possible by the Lord‚Äôs great and saving deeds and the descent of the Holy Spirit. Here in these sacred pages we discover what St. Paul calls ‚Äúnew creation in Christ.‚Äù

Here we discover what is the birth-right of Christians ‚Äì that is the continuous miracle of church life. Lecture titles are as follows: 

Lecture #1 The Meaning of the Acts 

Lecture #2 Pentecost 

Lecture #3 Spiritual Life 

Lecture #4 Fellowship 

Lecture #5 Martyrdom 

Lecture #6 Conversion 

Lecture #7 Defending the Faith: The Jerusalem Council 

Lecture #8 The Missionary Journeys of St. Paul 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

2) Make a Donation -Patristic Nectar is a small non-profit ministry with a big vision for expanding access to Patristic Orthodox teaching throughout the world. Since our establishment in 2010, we have made steady progress but there is so much more we could do. With funding, we can work to make our ministry vision a reality. 

https://patristicnectar.org/donations

The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles

Click Here: https://patristicnectar.org/store_lectures

 Our Newest  Lecture Series:
The Original Church: Lectures on the Acts of the Apostles by Father Josiah Trenham. 

The Acts was written by the Holy Apostle and Evangelist Luke, as the 2nd part of his great literary masterpiece setting forth the Life of Jesus Christ in his Gospel, and then in the Acts showing forth the new Christian life made possible by the Lord‚Äôs great and saving deeds and the descent of the Holy Spirit. Here in these sacred pages we discover what St. Paul calls ‚Äúnew creation in Christ.‚Äù

Here we discover what is the birth-right of Christians ‚Äì that is the continuous miracle of church life. Lecture titles are as follows: 

Lecture #1 The Meaning of the Acts

title: The Nine Orders of Angels
description:
Father Josiah Trenham

Merch Link:  https://patristic-nectar.mybigcommerce.com/

Patristic Nectar Kids : https://www.youtube.com/@PatristicNectarKids

TEXT ‚ÄúPNP‚Äù to 53-555 to Donate Today!

Our Newest Lecture Series:
Demonology: Understanding & Winning the Spiritual Battle

Click Here: https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11222221112

The study of the Church‚Äôs demonology is a part of basic catechism and Christian instruction. The Scriptures are replete with teachings about the dark powers. Additionally, it is impossible to appreciate the magnitude of the saving deeds of our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, without understanding how He, and He alone, has conquered Satan and destroyed his works. Lastly, Christians are called to fight and win in the spiritual war, and for this reason, it is essential that believers understand their enemies and their tactics. Toward this end, Father Josiah presents in these lectures in-depth studies of the Scriptures, Divine Services, and pedagogy of great saints and teachers on the subject of Satan and spiritual battle. 

Lecture titles include: 

Lecture #1 Jesus and Satan 

Lecture #2 Demonology in the Baptismal Rite and the Divine Liturgy 

Lecture #3 Gaining Mastery of Satan: The Life of St. Anthony the Great 

Lecture #4 How to Win the Spiritual Battle according to St. John of the Ladder 

Lecture #5 Engaging the Unseen Warfare: Fr. Lorenzo Scupoli and St. Nicodemos of the Holy Mountain 

Lecture #6 C. S. Lewis‚Äô Screwtape Letters and Demonic Warfare in the 21st Century Falling West 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

title: Fall 2023 Conference - "Every Thought Captive: Cultivating the Christian Mind" Watch From Anywhere!
description:
üìÖ Save the Date: October 13-15, 2023
üìç Riverside, CA

Join us for the Fall 2023 PNP Conference!

üé§ Speakers:
Fr. Alexis Torrance, a renowned professor at the University of Notre Dame.

Pres. Dr. Jeannie Constantinou, author of the thought-provoking book "Thinking Orthodox."

üìù Register now and secure your spot.

üì∫ What to Expect:

Live Stream the Lectures: Can't make it in person? Tune in online to catch the lectures in real time.
Join Us In Person: Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of the conference in Riverside, CA.
Watch Recordings Later: Missed a lecture? No worries. Access the recordings at your convenience.

Meals and Childcare provided for in-person participants.

üìö Lecture Topics:

Lecture #1 - The Apostolic Origins of the Orthodox Mind
Lecture #2 - The Deterioration of the Apostolic Mind in Western Europe
Lecture #3 - The Renewing of the Mind Through the Life of Repentance
Lecture #4 - The Deification of the Mind By the Light of Christ
Lecture #5 - Contemporary Dangers Threatening the Orthodox Mind and Life

Don't miss this opportunity to expand your knowledge and engage with renowned speakers on crucial topics. Mark your calendars and register today!

title: Church Growth: Do Numbers Matter?
description:
Father Josiah Trenham

Our Newest Lecture Series:
Demonology: Understanding & Winning the Spiritual Battle

Click Here: https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11222221112

The study of the Church‚Äôs demonology is a part of basic catechism and Christian instruction. The Scriptures are replete with teaching on the dark powers. Additionally, it is impossible to appreciate the magnitude of the saving deeds of our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, without understanding how He, and He alone, has conquered Satan and destroyed his works. Lastly, Christians are called to fight and win in the spiritual war, and for this reason, it is essential that believers understand their enemies and their tactics. Toward this end, Father Josiah presents in these lectures in-depth studies of the Scriptures, Divine Services, and pedagogy of great saints and teachers on the subject of Satan and spiritual battle. 

Lecture titles include: 

Lecture #1 Jesus and Satan 

Lecture #2 Demonology in the Baptismal Rite and the Divine Liturgy 

Lecture #3 Gaining Mastery of Satan: The Life of St. Anthony the Great 

Lecture #4 How to Win the Spiritual Battle according to St. John of the Ladder 

Lecture #5 Engaging the Unseen Warfare: Fr. Lorenzo Scupoli and St. Nicodemos of the Holy Mountain 

Lecture #6 C. S. Lewis‚Äô Screwtape Letters and Demonic Warfare in the 21st Century Falling West 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

title: Lot's Vexation
description:
August 1st, 2023
Father Josiah Trenham

Demonology: Understanding & Winning the Spiritual Battle

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122222111

The study of the Church‚Äôs demonology is a part of basic catechism and Christian instruction. The Scriptures are replete with teaching on the dark powers. Additionally, it is impossible to appreciate the magnitude of the saving deeds of our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, without understanding how He, and He alone, has conquered Satan and destroyed his works. Lastly, Christians are called to fight and win in the spiritual war, and for this reason, it is essential that believers understand their enemies and their tactics. Toward this end, Father Josiah presents in these lectures in-depth studies of the Scriptures, Divine Services, and pedagogy of great saints and teachers on the subject of Satan and spiritual battle. 

Lecture titles include: 

Lecture #1 Jesus and Satan 

Lecture #2 Demonology in the Baptismal Rite and the Divine Liturgy 

Lecture #3 Gaining Mastery of Satan: The Life of St. Anthony the Great 

Lecture #4 How to Win the Spiritual Battle according to St. John of the Ladder 

Lecture #5 Engaging the Unseen Warfare: Fr. Lorenzo Scupoli and St. Nicodemos of the Holy Mountain 

Lecture #6 C. S. Lewis‚Äô Screwtape Letters and Demonic Warfare in the 21st Century Falling West

title: When Resistance to Sin Seems Futile
description:
July 28th, 2023
Father Josiah Trenham

Download our Digital Catalogue here:
https://www.patristicnectar.org/digitalcatalogue

Origins: Creationism, Evolution, and an Orthodox Theology of Creation 

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122222

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new five-lecture series by His Grace, Irenei, Bishop of London and Western Europe for the Russian Orthodox Church Outside of Russia, entitled ORIGINS: Creationism, Evolution and an Orthodox Theology of Creation. Well-known patristics scholar and respected arch-pastor Bishop Irenei labors in this series to help believers approach the theology of creation from the presuppositions of the Church instead of through the prisms of evolution and creationism. By an intensive examination of the foundational texts of Genesis, together with numerous sources from the Church Fathers, Bishop Irenei enables us to perceive the Church‚Äôs own theological priorities and emphases when addressing the subject of creation.

Lecture titles include:   

Lecture #1 The Lamb Slain Before the Foundation of the World: Moving Beyond Creationism and Evolution 

Lecture #2 The Order of Salvation: The Creation of the Cosmos as the Beginning of the Church in Genesis 

Lecture #3 The Fashioning of Man: The Pinnacle of Creation 

Lecture #4 Creation and Its Consequences: The Sanctity of Life and Ecology 

Lecture #5 Review with Q and A 


If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

title: A Primer on the Nicene Creed
description:
May 26th, 2023
Father Josiah Trenham

The Nicene Creed: An Introduction

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_112222211

The Nicene Creed is the singular and universal statement of faith of the one, holy, catholic and apostolic Church. It possesses complete authority in the Orthodox Church and is recited in every Divine Liturgy, and daily in the prayers of the faithful. In these lectures, the Christian faith is summarized, and the content of the Creed itself is examined so that the ‚Äúfaith once delivered to the saints‚Äù can be known, embraced, and lived.

Lecture 1 The History and Use of the Nicene Creed
Lecture 2 The Almighty God
Lecture 3 Jesus Christ, the Son of God
Lecture 4 The Holy Spirit
Lecture 5 The One Church
 

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

Sunday Homilies and Theological Reflections with Fr. Josiah Trenham. Weekly homilies and theological reflections recorded from the amvon of St. Andrew Orthodox Church in Riverside, California. We thank you for allowing us to be a part of your spiritual quest, and we hope that your listening experience is an edifying one.

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîLINKS‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


https://patristicnectar.org/

Origins: Creationism, Evolution, and an Orthodox Theology of Creation 

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122222

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new five-lecture series by His Grace, Irenei, Bishop of London and Western Europe for the Russian Orthodox Church Outside of Russia, entitled ORIGINS: Creationism, Evolution and an Orthodox Theology of Creation. Well-known patristics scholar and respected arch-pastor Bishop Irenei labors in this series to help believers approach the theology of creation from the presuppositions of the Church instead of through the prisms of evolution and creationism. By an intensive examination of the foundational texts of Genesis, together with numerous sources from the Church Fathers, Bishop Irenei enables us to perceive the Church‚Äôs own theological priorities and emphases when addressing the subject of creation.

Lecture titles include:   

Lecture #1 The Lamb Slain Before the Foundation of the World: Moving Beyond Creationism and Evolution 

Lecture #2 The Order of Salvation: The Creation of the Cosmos as the Beginning of the Church in Genesis 

Lecture #3 The Fashioning of Man: The Pinnacle of Creation 

Lecture #4 Creation and Its Consequences: The Sanctity of Life and Ecology 

Lecture #5 Review with Q and A

title: The Humiliation of Hell
description:
April 11th, 2023
Father Josiah Trenham

Yielded to God: The Life and Teaching of Saint Seraphim of Sarov

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122221

The significance of the life of St. Seraphim upon contemporary Orthodox Christianity is so great that it is difficult to fully grasp. Though he was a humble Russian monk born in 1759 his influence has spread to become central and definitive in all the world-wide Orthodox Church. The life of the saints is a tapestry of a life wholly crucified to self and fully yielded to the will of God. His teaching on the purpose of Christian life as the acquisition of the Holy Spirit, and his great intimacy with the Most Pure Mother of God have captured the hearts of God-lovers and provided inspiration for spiritual acquisition for almost two centuries.

Lecture 1 Yielded to God: An Overview of the Life of St. Seraphim
Lecture 2 Acquiring the Holy Spirit: The Purpose of the Christian Life
Lecture 3 St. Seraphim and the Mother of GodLecture #4 Marriage, Monasticism, and the Saint‚Äôs Diveyevo Nuns
Lecture 5 Spiritual Counsels

title: Establishing Our Identity | Bishop Irenei
description:
March 31, 2023
Father Josiah Trenham
Bishop Irenei of London & Western Europe

For more information on His Grace, Bishop Irenei, see here: https://www.patristicnectar.org/bishop_irenei

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîLINKS‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Yielded to God: The Life and Teaching of Saint Seraphim of Sarov

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1122221

The significance of the life of St. Seraphim upon contemporary Orthodox Christianity is so great that it is difficult to fully grasp. Though he was a humble Russian monk born in 1759 his influence has spread to become central and definitive in all the world-wide Orthodox Church. The life of the saints is a tapestry of a life wholly crucified to self and fully yielded to the will of God. His teaching on the purpose of Christian life as the acquisition of the Holy Spirit, and his great intimacy with the Most Pure Mother of God have captured the hearts of God-lovers and provided inspiration for spiritual acquisition for almost two centuries.

Lecture 1 Yielded to God: An Overview of the Life of St. Seraphim
Lecture 2 Acquiring the Holy Spirit: The Purpose of the Christian Life
Lecture 3 St. Seraphim and the Mother of GodLecture #4 Marriage, Monasticism, and the Saint‚Äôs Diveyevo Nuns
Lecture 5 Spiritual Counsels

title: What Jesus Called Us To
description:
Father Josiah Trenham

‚ÄúTherefore do not worry, saying, ‚ÄòWhat shall we eat?‚Äô or ‚ÄòWhat shall we drink?‚Äô or ‚ÄòWhat shall we wear?‚Äô For after all these things the Gentiles seek. For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things. But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added to you. Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.

This is a short clip from a longer Vlog entitled ‚ÄúHeaven is for Real‚Äù and can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nrOMR4eqvnU

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

Watch the full video "Heaven is for Real" here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nrOMR4eqvnU

title: Chrismation Changes Everything
description:
Father Josiah Trenham

Chrismation changes everything. Chrismation, (from Greek chriein, ‚Äúto anoint‚Äù), in Holy Orghodoxy, is a sacrament that, together with baptism, introduces new members into the church. It is the Eastern equivalent of confirmation in the West. 

This is a short clip from a longer Vlog entitled ‚ÄúChrismation Changes Everything!‚Äù And can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvDKTcOsujY

title: Heaven is for Real
description:
December 2nd,  2022
Father Josiah Trenham

Instructions for downloading our web app:
https://www.patristicnectar.org/app

If you are interested in other available titles, or if you would like more information on Patristic Nectar Publications, please visit our website at www.PatristicNectar.org

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîLINKS‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

https://patristicnectar.org/

Heaven Our True Home
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new 7 lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Heaven: Our True Home. One of the most shocking realities of the preaching and teaching of our Lord Jesus Christ to His early 1st century Judean audience was His fervent, expansive, and repetitive teaching on heaven. Heaven literally permeates the Sermon on the Mount and our Savior‚Äôs Parabolic instruction. The Holy Apostles received this single-eyed focus upon the next life from the Lord Christ and passed this teaching on to their disciples in the early Church. Sacred tradition has vivified and animated the discipleship of Christians in their race toward heaven ever since. In these lectures, Father Josiah opens the Scriptures and the writings of the Church Fathers on the subject of heaven in an effort to plant a deep impression of the future life of God‚Äôs children, and to stir up a great desire for obtaining it.

Lecture titles are:                                                 

Lecture #1 Heaven in the Holy Gospels

Lecture #2 Heaven in the Acts of the Apostles and the Epistles

Lecture #3 Heaven in the Apocalypse

Lecture #4 Heaven in the Church Fathers: A Florilegium

Lecture #5 Heaven: A Definitive End and a New Beginning

Lecture #6 What is Heaven Actually Like: Common Questions

Lecture #7 Heaven Mislaid: The Eclipse of Heaven in the Secular West and the Christian Response

description:
November 29th,  2022
Father Josiah Trenham

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîLINKS‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî  

https://patristicnectar.org/

My Life in Christ: The Life & Teaching of Saint John of Kronstadt
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11221

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new 9-part lecture series entitled My Life in Christ: The Life and Teaching of St. John of Kronstadt. This series consists of two parts. The first consists of four thematic lectures given in 2022 by Fr. Josiah to the St. John Chrysostom Catechetical School in Riverside, Ca. The second part of this series is five talks given by His Grace, Bishop Basil of Wichita, at a men‚Äôs retreat in Kansas in 2008. St. John of Kronstadt, the Wonder-Worker, served God in Russia during the second half of the 19th century and fell asleep in Christ in 1908. His life, miracles, and teaching have been cherished by believers as God‚Äôs love gift to the Church and to the world on the cusp of the 20th century, the most violent century in the history of humanity.  These lectures and discussions reveal the beauty of a life lived supremely in and for Jesus Christ the Lord.

Lecture #1 - The Life of Saint John of Kronstadt

Lecture #2 - On Prayer

Lecture #3 - The Eucharist and Divine Liturgy

Lecture #4 - On the Priesthood

Lecture #5 - The Russia of St. John of Kronstadt

Lecture #6 - Confession and Communion in St. John's Teaching

Lecture #7 - Q&A (Part 1)

Lecture #8 - St. John Counsels and Teachings on Prayer

Lecture #9 - Q&A (Part 2)

My Life in Christ: The LIfe & Teaching of Saint John of Kronstadt
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11221

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new 9-part lecture series entitled My Life in Christ: The Life and Teaching of St. John of Kronstadt. This series consists of two parts. The first consists of four thematic lectures given in 2022 by Fr. Josiah to the St. John Chrysostom Catechetical School in Riverside, Ca. The second part of this series is five talks given by His Grace, Bishop Basil of Wichita, at a men‚Äôs retreat in Kansas in 2008. St. John of Kronstadt, the Wonder-Worker, served God in Russia during the second half of the 19th century and fell asleep in Christ in 1908. His life, miracles, and teaching have been cherished by believers as God‚Äôs love gift to the Church and to the world on the cusp of the 20th century, the most violent century in the history of humanity.  These lectures and discussions reveal the beauty of a life lived supremely in and for Jesus Christ the Lord.

Lecture #1 - The Life of Saint John of Kronstadt

Father Josiah Trenham

‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîLINKS‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî  

https://patristicnectar.org/

Sirach: Fashioning a Life of Wisdom 
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_112

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new five-lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Sirach: Fashioning a Life of Wisdom. The Wisdom of Sirach or Ecclesiasticus, as the book is known in the Western or Latin tradition, is a choice composition from the Wisdom literature of the Old Testament.‚ÄØ Written in the 2nd century BC in Hebrew and translated into Greek by the author's grandson in Alexandria, Egypt, this majestic portion of Holy Scripture combines the rich aphorisms of traditional Hebrew sapiential literature with the concerns and background of 2nd-century Hellenic culture. Jesus, the Son of Sirach, was highly prized by the Church Fathers from the earliest days of the Church. In these five lectures, Father Josiah hones‚ÄØin on the themes of learning and seeking wisdom, humility, work, wealth, almsgiving, friendship, social life, wives, women, medicine and physicians, youth and aging, and wise speech and the power of words. In these topical lectures, practical substance is given to the practice of the fear of God in a wide array of human activity so that the servant of God pleases the Lord and lives thoroughly and thoughtfully before Him.‚ÄØ 

Lecture #1 - Learning and Humility.

Lecture #2 - Work and Wealth in Sirach

Lecture #3 - Almsgiving, Friendship, and Social Relations

Lecture #4 - Wives, Women, and the Stages of Life

Lecture #5 - Wise Words

title: The Most Important Real Estate - #jesus #god  #christianity  #orthodoxchristianity
description:
Father Josiah Trenham

The Icon:
Saint Sisoes at the open tomb of Alexander the Great who exclaims:

‚ÄòSeeing you in a grave, I am timid and frightened at your sight and I shed tears from my heart, bringing to my mind the debt that all people have to pay (that is, death), so I will suffer such an end. Ah, ah death, who is the one who can avoid you?‚Äô

title: Ultimate Conversion Therapy - #jesus #god  #christianity  #orthodoxchristianity
description:
Father Josiah Trenham featured in the Tucker Carlson Originals two part documentary Transgressive: The Cult of Confusion streaming now on FoxNation. 

Also check out the lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Male and Female: Reflections on Transgenderism. These audio lectures directly address this latest iteration of the sexual revolution and the sexual anarchy unleashed by a cultural rejection of the Christian theological foundations of creation, anthropology, sexuality, and the traditional therapeutic paths of the Church. These lectures explain why Christians cannot reasonably avoid studying transgender ideology in today‚Äôs cultural climate, how this new world-view on sexuality finds itself deficient in explaining and healing our fallen human condition, and how love must compel believers to open their arms to persons seeking God from a transgender background.

Sirach: Fashioning a Life of Wisdom 
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_112

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new five-lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Sirach: Fashioning a Life of Wisdom. The Wisdom of Sirach or Ecclesiasticus, as the book is known in the Western or Latin tradition, is a choice composition from the Wisdom literature of the Old Testament.‚ÄØ Written in the 2nd century BC in Hebrew and translated into Greek by the author's grandson in Alexandria, Egypt, this majestic portion of Holy Scripture combines the rich aphorisms of traditional Hebrew sapiential literature with the concerns and background of 2nd-century Hellenic culture. Jesus, the Son of Sirach, was highly prized by the Church Fathers from the earliest days of the Church. In these five lectures, Father Josiah hones‚ÄØin on the themes of learning and seeking wisdom, humility, work, wealth, almsgiving, friendship, social life, wives, women, medicine and physicians, youth and aging, and wise speech and the power of words. In these topical lectures, practical substance is given to the practice of the fear of God in a wide array of human activity so that the servant of God pleases the Lord and lives thoroughly and thoughtfully before Him.‚ÄØ 

Lecture #1 - Learning and Humility.

Lecture #2 - Work and Wealth in Sirach

Lecture #3 - Almsgiving, Friendship, and Social Relations

Lecture #4 - Wives, Women, and the Stages of Life

Lecture #5 - Wise Words

description:
Father Josiah Trenham featured in the Tucker Carlson Originals two part documentary Transgressive: The Cult of Confusion streaming now on FoxNation. 

Also check out the lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Male and Female: Reflections on Transgenderism. These audio lectures directly address this latest iteration of the sexual revolution and the sexual anarchy unleashed by a cultural rejection of the Christian theological foundations of creation, anthropology, sexuality, and the traditional therapeutic paths of the Church. These lectures explain why Christians cannot reasonably avoid studying transgender ideology in today‚Äôs cultural climate, how this new world-view on sexuality finds itself deficient in explaining and healing our fallen human condition, and how love must compel believers to open their arms to persons seeking God from a transgender background.

Heaven Our True Home
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new 7 lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Heaven: Our True Home. One of the most shocking realities of the preaching and teaching of our Lord Jesus Christ to His early 1st century Judean audience was His fervent, expansive, and repetitive teaching on heaven. Heaven literally permeates the Sermon on the Mount and our Savior‚Äôs Parabolic instruction. The Holy Apostles received this single-eyed focus upon the next life from the Lord Christ and passed this teaching on to their disciples in the early Church. Sacred tradition has vivified and animated the discipleship of Christians in their race toward heaven ever since. In these lectures, Father Josiah opens the Scriptures and the writings of the Church Fathers on the subject of heaven in an effort to plant a deep impression of the future life of God‚Äôs children, and to stir up a great desire for obtaining it.

Lecture titles are:                                                 

Lecture #1 Heaven in the Holy Gospels

Lecture #2 Heaven in the Acts of the Apostles and the Epistles

Lecture #3 Heaven in the Apocalypse

Lecture #4 Heaven in the Church Fathers: A Florilegium

Lecture #5 Heaven: A Definitive End and a New Beginning

Lecture #6 What is Heaven Actually Like: Common Questions

Lecture #7 Heaven Mislaid: The Eclipse of Heaven in the Secular West and the Christian Response

title: First Thoughts and Words
description:
Father Josiah Trenham

www.PatristicNectar.org

Your first thoughts and words of the day, when you wake up are exceedingly important. They set the course for the whole day. They fix the heart's disposition for what's coming. Why not allow your very first thoughts and your very first words, when you wake up in the morning, to be given to God.

title: Why Icons Look the Way They Do
description:
This interview was conducted at the conclusion of the 2022 Annual Patristic Nectar Conference, held at Saint Andrew Orthodox Christian Church, in Riverside California. If you found this interview to be of interest, and would like a deeper dive into the topic, follow the link below and watch the seven lectures and Q&A sessions delivered at the conference. 

Click the link below :
https://www.crowdcast.io/e/holyorthodoxy/register

Registration includes the audio lectures delivered to your Patristic Nectar account library.

or purchase the audio only lectures (video lectures not included, must register with link above):

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1

Fr Maximos is Professor of Patristics and Orthodox Spirituality. A summa cum laude graduate of Holy Cross (1987), he completed his PhD in Patristics and Historical Theology at the Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C. (1993), after which he taught at Hellenic College and Holy Cross (1993-1998). In the fall of 1998, he was invited to join the faculty of Harvard Divinity School, where he was Professor of Patristics and Orthodox Theology from 1998-2004. Responding to a life-long calling to the monastic life, he resigned his position at Harvard and was tonsured a great-schema monk at the Holy Monastery of Simonopetra, where he lived from 2004-2011. He was subsequently invited by Archbishop Demetrios to return to Holy Cross, where he has been an outstanding teacher, rigorous academic mentor, and prolific scholar. His publications include five books, more than fifty articles (many of them of monograph-length), and a dozen translated volumes. His current research project is a first-ever critical edition and English translation of the Life of the Virgin by the tenth-century Byzantine writer John Geometres.

Fr. Maximos teaches courses on the theology of the Church Fathers, including St Basil the Great, St Gregory the Theologian, St Dionysius the Areopagite, St Symeon the New Theologian, and especially St Maximos the Confessor, on whom he is an internationally recognized specialist. His research interests focus on the Patristic and Byzantine interpretation of Scripture, the Philokalia and Orthodox spirituality, the study of Byzantine manuscripts, and the theological study of Byzantine art, icons, and iconography. Fr Maximos‚Äô interest in the arts began with a program of study at the School of Visual Arts in New York City (1979-1980), and he currently works as a consultant for American filmmaker Terrence Malick, including work on Malick‚Äôs most recent film, A Hidden Life, which is based on the real-life story of Franz J√§gerst√§tter, an Austrian conscientious objector during World War II, who was sentenced to death and executed. He was later declared a martyr and beatified by the Roman Catholic Church.

Fr Maximos has twice held fellowships at Dumbarton Oaks, Harvard University‚Äôs Center for Byzantine Studies in Washington, D.C. (1992-1993, 2000-2002); he was the Inaugural James Rubin Visiting Professor of Patristic and Byzantine Studies at Hebrew University, Jerusalem (1991-1992); and a Visiting Professor of Patristics and Byzantine Literature and Consultant to the Thesaurus Linguae Graecae (UCLA, Irvine, 2001). In 2003, he was invited to teach Orthodox Theology at the √âcole Pratique des Hautes √âtudes in Paris; and in 2016, he served as a Visiting Professor of Byzantine Literature at Harvard University‚Äôs Department of the Classics (2016). He is a member of numerous international theological societies, and serves on multiple editorial boards, including Analogia: A Journal of Theological Dialogue; and Harvard University‚Äôs prestigious Dumbarton Oaks Medieval Library series.

Fr Maximos is the author of Proclus of Constantinople and the Cult of the Virgin in Late Antiquity (2003); Maximos the Confessor, On Difficulties in the Church Fathers: The Ambigua to Thomas and John (2014); The Art of Seeing: Paradox and Perception in Orthodox Iconography (2014); Mother of the Light: Prayers to the Theotokos (2018); Maximos the Confessor, On Difficulties in Sacred Scripture: The Responses to the Questions of Thalassios (2019); St John Chrysostom and the Jesus Prayer: A Contribution to the Study of the Philokalia (2019); and The Light of the World: Prayers to our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ (2020). He has also translated four volumes of the writings of the Athonite Elder Aimilianos of Simonopetra: The Church at Prayer: The Mystical Liturgy of the Heart (2005); The Way of the Spirit: Reflections on Life in God (2009); Psalms and the Life of Faith (2015); and The Mystical Marriage: Spiritual Life according to St Maximos the Confessor (2018).

Fr. Maximos is currently Interim Dean of Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology.

Fr Bogdan Bucur was born in Romania. He is married to Cristina and they are the parents of Irina (21), Andrei (10), and Miruna (6). After studying at the Faculty of Orthodox Theology in Bucharest (1994-1999), Fr Bogdan left for the USA, where he earned his MA (2002) and PhD (2007) in Religious Studies at Marquette University under the direction of (now Archbishop) Alexander Golitzin. Between 2007 and 2020, he was Assistant and then Associate Professor of Theology at Duquesne University, in Pittsburgh, where he worked in the areas of Early Christian Studies and Reception History of the Bible. In 2010 he was ordained a priest in the Antiochian Orthodox Archdiocese and served as the pastor of St Anthony Orthodox Church in Butler, PA (2010-2020).

Fr Bogdan is a scholar of early Christianity, with a special interest in the link between reception history of the Bible and doctrinal developments in early Christianity and the Byzantine tradition. He views it as important to study how early Christians articulated their religious identity by reworking doctrines, imagery, and practices inherited from the many currents of Second Temple Judaism. His academic interests were shaped significantly by participation in the interdisciplinary Seminar on the Jewish Roots of Christian Mysticism, and the "Theophaneia School", both led by Professor Andrei Orlov and Archbishop Dr. Alexander Golitzin at Marquette University.

description:

Father Josiah Trenham

https://patristicnectar.org/

Heaven Our True Home
https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_11

Patristic Nectar Publications is pleased to present a new 7 lecture series by Father Josiah Trenham entitled Heaven: Our True Home. One of the most shocking realities of the preaching and teaching of our Lord Jesus Christ to His early 1st century Judean audience was His fervent, expansive, and repetitive teaching on heaven. Heaven literally permeates the Sermon on the Mount and our Savior‚Äôs Parabolic instruction. The Holy Apostles received this single-eyed focus upon the next life from the Lord Christ and passed this teaching on to their disciples in the early Church. Sacred tradition has vivified and animated the discipleship of Christians in their race toward heaven ever since. In these lectures, Father Josiah opens the Scriptures and the writings of the Church Fathers on the subject of heaven in an effort to plant a deep impression of the future life of God‚Äôs children, and to stir up a great desire for obtaining it.

Lecture titles are:                                                 

Lecture #1 Heaven in the Holy Gospels

Lecture #2 Heaven in the Acts of the Apostles and the Epistles

Lecture #3 Heaven in the Apocalypse

Lecture #4 Heaven in the Church Fathers: A Florilegium

Lecture #5 Heaven: A Definitive End and a New Beginning

Lecture #6 What is Heaven Actually Like: Common Questions

Lecture #7 Heaven Mislaid: The Eclipse of Heaven in the Secular West and the Christian Response

description:
This interview was conducted at the conclusion of the 2022 Annual Patristic Nectar Conference, held at Saint Andrew Orthodox Christian Church, in Riverside California. If you found this interview to be of interest, and would like a deeper dive into the topic, follow the link below and watch the seven lectures and Q&A sessions delivered at the conference.

or purchase the audio only lectures (video lectures not included, must register with link above):

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1

Fr Maximos is Professor of Patristics and Orthodox Spirituality. A summa cum laude graduate of Holy Cross (1987), he completed his PhD in Patristics and Historical Theology at the Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C. (1993), after which he taught at Hellenic College and Holy Cross (1993-1998). In the fall of 1998, he was invited to join the faculty of Harvard Divinity School, where he was Professor of Patristics and Orthodox Theology from 1998-2004. Responding to a life-long calling to the monastic life, he resigned his position at Harvard and was tonsured a great-schema monk at the Holy Monastery of Simonopetra, where he lived from 2004-2011. He was subsequently invited by Archbishop Demetrios to return to Holy Cross, where he has been an outstanding teacher, rigorous academic mentor, and prolific scholar. His publications include five books, more than fifty articles (many of them of monograph-length), and a dozen translated volumes. His current research project is a first-ever critical edition and English translation of the Life of the Virgin by the tenth-century Byzantine writer John Geometres.

Fr. Maximos teaches courses on the theology of the Church Fathers, including St Basil the Great, St Gregory the Theologian, St Dionysius the Areopagite, St Symeon the New Theologian, and especially St Maximos the Confessor, on whom he is an internationally recognized specialist. His research interests focus on the Patristic and Byzantine interpretation of Scripture, the Philokalia and Orthodox spirituality, the study of Byzantine manuscripts, and the theological study of Byzantine art, icons, and iconography. Fr Maximos‚Äô interest in the arts began with a program of study at the School of Visual Arts in New York City (1979-1980), and he currently works as a consultant for American filmmaker Terrence Malick, including work on Malick‚Äôs most recent film, A Hidden Life, which is based on the real-life story of Franz J√§gerst√§tter, an Austrian conscientious objector during World War II, who was sentenced to death and executed. He was later declared a martyr and beatified by the Roman Catholic Church.

Fr Maximos has twice held fellowships at Dumbarton Oaks, Harvard University‚Äôs Center for Byzantine Studies in Washington, D.C. (1992-1993, 2000-2002); he was the Inaugural James Rubin Visiting Professor of Patristic and Byzantine Studies at Hebrew University, Jerusalem (1991-1992); and a Visiting Professor of Patristics and Byzantine Literature and Consultant to the Thesaurus Linguae Graecae (UCLA, Irvine, 2001). In 2003, he was invited to teach Orthodox Theology at the √âcole Pratique des Hautes √âtudes in Paris; and in 2016, he served as a Visiting Professor of Byzantine Literature at Harvard University‚Äôs Department of the Classics (2016). He is a member of numerous international theological societies, and serves on multiple editorial boards, including Analogia: A Journal of Theological Dialogue; and Harvard University‚Äôs prestigious Dumbarton Oaks Medieval Library series.

Fr Maximos is the author of Proclus of Constantinople and the Cult of the Virgin in Late Antiquity (2003); Maximos the Confessor, On Difficulties in the Church Fathers: The Ambigua to Thomas and John (2014); The Art of Seeing: Paradox and Perception in Orthodox Iconography (2014); Mother of the Light: Prayers to the Theotokos (2018); Maximos the Confessor, On Difficulties in Sacred Scripture: The Responses to the Questions of Thalassios (2019); St John Chrysostom and the Jesus Prayer: A Contribution to the Study of the Philokalia (2019); and The Light of the World: Prayers to our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ (2020). He has also translated four volumes of the writings of the Athonite Elder Aimilianos of Simonopetra: The Church at Prayer: The Mystical Liturgy of the Heart (2005); The Way of the Spirit: Reflections on Life in God (2009); Psalms and the Life of Faith (2015); and The Mystical Marriage: Spiritual Life according to St Maximos the Confessor (2018).

Fr. Maximos is currently Interim Dean of Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology.

title: Apophatic Theology | Dr  Tikhon Pino
description:
This interview was conducted at the conclusion of the 2022 Annual Patristic Nectar Conference, held at Saint Andrew Orthodox Christian Church, in Riverside California. If you found this interview to be of interest, and would like a deeper dive into the topic, follow the link below and watch the seven lectures and Q&A sessions delivered at the conference.

https://www.crowdcast.io/e/holyorthodoxy/register

or purchase the audio only lectures (video lectures not included, must register with link above):

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1

Dr. Pino holds a BA in Greek and Latin (Classics) from the Catholic University of America (2005), an MTS from Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology (2013), and a PhD from Marquette University (2021). A revised version of his dissertation (written under the direction of Marcus Plested) is currently at press with Routledge: Essence and Energies: Being and Naming God in St. Gregory Palamas. He has published widely on the Greek theological tradition, including articles on Aristotle and Plotinus, Philo of Alexandria, Basil of Ancyra, Maximos the Confessor, Mark of Ephesos, and the interaction of Byzantine and Scholastic Theology. His work has appeared in the Journal of Theological Studies, the Journal of Early Christian Studies, the Heythrop Journal, Analogia, Franciscan Studies, Dionysius, and Byzantinisches Archive - Series Philosophica (De Gruyter). He is currently editing two collections: The Legacy of St. Gregory Palamas: Studies in Late Byzantine Theology and its Reception, and Ephrem Graecus: The Greek Writings Attributed to St. Ephrem the Syrian in Byzantium.

The Apostolic Fathers | 5 Lectures

A review of the earliest post-New Testament Christian literature providing inspiring examples of Christian devotion and the ethos of the Christian generations immediately following the Apostolic period.  These writings are replete with inspiring examples of Christian devotion and provide a valuable window into both the significant personalities and the spiritual and theological ethos of the Christian generations immediately following the Apostolic period. These texts are also of great apologetic value in the contemporary pluralistic milieu in which Orthodox Christians dwell in the West.

https://patristicnectar.org/bookstore_220620_1

Fr Maximos is Professor of Patristics and Orthodox Spirituality. A summa cum laude graduate of Holy Cross (1987), he completed his PhD in Patristics and Historical Theology at the Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C. (1993), after which he taught at Hellenic College and Holy Cross (1993-1998). In the fall of 1998, he was invited to join the faculty of Harvard Divinity School, where he was Professor of Patristics and Orthodox Theology from 1998-2004. Responding to a life-long calling to the monastic life, he resigned his position at Harvard and was tonsured a great-schema monk at the Holy Monastery of Simonopetra, where he lived from 2004-2011. He was subsequently invited by Archbishop Demetrios to return to Holy Cross, where he has been an outstanding teacher, rigorous academic mentor, and prolific scholar. His publications include five books, more than fifty articles (many of them of monograph-length), and a dozen translated volumes. His current research project is a first-ever critical edition and English translation of the Life of the Virgin by the tenth-century Byzantine writer John Geometres.

Fr. Maximos teaches courses on the theology of the Church Fathers, including St Basil the Great, St Gregory the Theologian, St Dionysius the Areopagite, St Symeon the New Theologian, and especially St Maximos the Confessor, on whom he is an internationally recognized specialist. His research interests focus on the Patristic and Byzantine interpretation of Scripture, the Philokalia and Orthodox spirituality, the study of Byzantine manuscripts, and the theological study of Byzantine art, icons, and iconography. Fr Maximos‚Äô interest in the arts began with a program of study at the School of Visual Arts in New York City (1979-1980), and he currently works as a consultant for American filmmaker Terrence Malick, including work on Malick‚Äôs most recent film, A Hidden Life, which is based on the real-life story of Franz J√§gerst√§tter, an Austrian conscientious objector during World War II, who was sentenced to death and executed. He was later declared a martyr and beatified by the Roman Catholic Church.

Fr Maximos has twice held fellowships at Dumbarton Oaks, Harvard University‚Äôs Center for Byzantine Studies in Washington, D.C. (1992-1993, 2000-2002); he was the Inaugural James Rubin Visiting Professor of Patristic and Byzantine Studies at Hebrew University, Jerusalem (1991-1992); and a Visiting Professor of Patristics and Byzantine Literature and Consultant to the Thesaurus Linguae Graecae (UCLA, Irvine, 2001). In 2003, he was invited to teach Orthodox Theology at the √âcole Pratique des Hautes √âtudes in Paris; and in 2016, he served as a Visiting Professor of Byzantine Literature at Harvard University‚Äôs Department of the Classics (2016). He is a member of numerous international theological societies, and serves on multiple editorial boards, including Analogia: A Journal of Theological Dialogue; and Harvard University‚Äôs prestigious Dumbarton Oaks Medieval Library series.

Fr Maximos is the author of Proclus of Constantinople and the Cult of the Virgin in Late Antiquity (2003); Maximos the Confessor, On Difficulties in the Church Fathers: The Ambigua to Thomas and John (2014); The Art of Seeing: Paradox and Perception in Orthodox Iconography (2014); Mother of the Light: Prayers to the Theotokos (2018); Maximos the Confessor, On Difficulties in Sacred Scripture: The Responses to the Questions of Thalassios (2019); St John Chrysostom and the Jesus Prayer: A Contribution to the Study of the Philokalia (2019); and The Light of the World: Prayers to our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ (2020). He has also translated four volumes of the writings of the Athonite Elder Aimilianos of Simonopetra: The Church at Prayer: The Mystical Liturgy of the Heart (2005); The Way of the Spirit: Reflections on Life in God (2009); Psalms and the Life of Faith (2015); and The Mystical Marriage: Spiritual Life according to St Maximos the Confessor (2018).

Fr. Maximos is currently Interim Dean of Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology.

Thank you for considering a donation to help Patristic Nectar create more FREE content for our listeners to be edified by; such as the Psalter for FREE on the Patristic Nectar platform and many more projects to come.

A donation of $200 or more will get you a limited edition Patristic Nectar branded coffee mug and an 8-ounce bag of whole coffee beans freshly roasted by Arcade Coffee Roasters in Riverside, California.

Patristic Nectar is pleased to offer a high-quality studio recording of the complete Psalter in the much-loved Holy Transfiguration Monastery Septuagint translation. The Psalter may be accessed by individual Psalms or by Kathisma and listened to absolutely free.

Our team is grateful to our donors' support to extend our reach to as many listeners as possible who want to deepen their Christian faith.

title: Priestly Priorities
description:
Date November 24th, 2021
Father Josiah Trenham

In this video, produced by Orthodox Inter Seminary Movement, Father Josiah discusses the priorities he has learned and maintained since he was first ordained. In particular, Father Josiah emphasizes how important it is for a priest to remember his identity of a Christian, a husband/father, and a priest when ministering so that he is not pulled away from what the Lord calls him to do.

You can watch other videos in this series here:
